intro: Carex deqinensis, commonly known as the Deqin sedge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Yunnan Province in China, where it thrives in moist, temperate climates. The plant is characterized by its grass-like leaves and spike-like flower clusters, typical of the sedge family. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals. Due to its limited distribution, Carex deqinensis is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
